constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

results.credit_line_for_label: © Gillian Wearing, Courtesy Maureen Paley, London; Tanya Bonakdar Gallery, New York and Regen Projects, Los Angeles

details.label: Materials

Collection of Naomi Milgrom AC

results.title: The CAAMA Group brochure
results.brief_description: In 1998, the Central Australian Aboriginal Media Association (CAAMA) launched the world’s first Indigenous owned and operated TV network, Imparja Television. Along with the establishment of Indigenous Community Television (ICTV) in 2001, these early initiatives paved the way for today’s broadcasters.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Australia → MA-07. First Peoples: Our stories, our way → MA-07-04 Birth of Indigenous Broadcasting

results.title: Live broadcast at the launch of EVTV
results.credit_line: Courtesy Rex Guthrie / PY Media / Ara Irititja Archive
results.brief_description:
EVTV live broadcast to Ernabella (Pukatja) community, 1985

Pantjiti McKenzie OAM presents a live broadcast during the launch of “Ernabella Video Television” (EVTV) to Pukatja community (Ernabella) in the Pitjantjatjara Lands of South Australia.
results.title_for_label: Live broadcast at the launch of EVTV
results.description:
